newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins dip on profit-taking, await US data.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins dip on profit-taking, await US data.

text.p: Prices of Russian MinFin bonds eased on profit-taking after some days of rise, with the market awaiting U.S. statistics data due on Friday, dealers said.
"We had a strong market yesterday, mainly led by Western investors," Eurobank dealer Olivier Coursault said. "Today's drop is normal as pepople are waiting for U.S. figures".
U.S. May unemployment, payroll and average hourly earnings data are due on Friday.
MinFins, along with other emerging debt, are sensitive to any news which would suggest a change in U.S. interest rates and U.S. Treasury bond prices.
Avtobank dealer Ivan Kuznetsov said Russian banks started the decline in early trading profit-taking.
